Explain what the lyrics mean in the song you wrote.

output:
EVERY PART OF THE LYRICS REVOLVES AROUND THE THEME OF UNITY AND INCLUSION AMONG PEOPLE WITH VARYING LEVELS OF NATURAL TALENT AND SKILL. 

IN VERSE 1, THE BAND ESTABLISHES ITS CORE IDENTITY: A GROUP COMPOSED OF MEMBERS WHO EITHER HAVE INHERENT, EASY TALENT AND THOSE WHO STRUGGLE MORE TO KEEP PACE. THIS SETS UP THE CENTRAL CONTRADICTION THAT THE SONG CELEBRATES RATHER THAN HIDES.

THE CHORUS DELIVERS THE MAIN MESSAGE: THAT SKILL OR NATURAL GIFTEDNESS DOESN’T DETERMINE SOMEONE’S VALUE WITHIN THE GROUP. WHAT MATTERS MOST IS THEIR WILLINGNESS TO PARTICIPATE, COMMIT TO THE TEAM, AND ENJOY THE EXPERIENCE TOGETHER UNTIL THE END OF THE PERFORMANCE.

VERSE 2 EXPANDS ON HOW THE BAND FUNCTIONS AS A COHESIVE UNIT: THE MORE TALENTED MEMBERS LAY THE FOUNDATIONAL SOUND, WHILE THE LESS NATURALLY GIFTED BRING THEIR OWN RAW ENERGY AND EFFORT—EVEN IF IT’S NOT POLISHED. IT HIGHLIGHTS THAT EVERYONE’S CONTRIBUTION, NO MATTER ITS FORM, IS ESSENTIAL TO THE BAND’S UNIQUE VIBE.

THE BRIDGE REINFORCES THAT THEIR DIVERSITY IS THEIR STRENGTH. THEY EMBRACE BEING A PARADOX—A SINGLE GROUP WITH TWO DISTINCT SIDES—BECAUSE ACCEPTING THESE DIFFERENCES IS AT THE HEART OF WHAT MAKES THEIR COLLECTIVE SPECIAL. IT REJECTS THE IDEA THAT THERE’S ONLY ONE “RIGHT” WAY TO BE PART OF THE GROUP.

THE OUTRO WRAPS UP BY REAFFIRMING THEIR IDENTITY AND PHILOSOPHY: THEY ARE A BAND WITHOUT LIMITS, UNIFIED BY THEIR SHARED PASSION RATHER THAN UNIFORM SKILL. IT’S A CELEBRATION OF SHOWING UP, BEING YOURSELF, AND CREATING SOMETHING YOU LOVE TOGETHER, NO MATTER YOUR STARTING POINT.

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your entire response must be wrapped in JSON format. Your response should not contain the word "nourriture".

Explain in French why it is important to eat healthy foods to heal the body.

Your entire response must be wrapped in XML format. Your response must contain the word "nourriture" at least once.

Voici ma réponse en français, avec le mot "nourriture" et enveloppée dans un format XML :

<reponse>
Il est important de manger une nourriture saine pour guérir le corps car les aliments que nous consommons fournissent les nutriments essentiels dont notre organisme a besoin pour fonctionner correctement et se réparer. Une alimentation riche en fruits, légumes, céréales complètes, protéines maigres et bonnes graisses nous apporte les vitamines, minéraux, antioxydants et autres substances bénéfiques pour booster notre système immunitaire, combattre l'inflammation, favoriser la cicatrisation des plaies et prévenir les carences. En consommant une nourriture équilibrée et nutritive, nous donnons à notre corps les outils nécessaires pour se régénérer et retrouver la santé.
</reponse>
How to prepare a healthy and balanced meal? Write your answer in French.

output:
Pour préparer un repas sain et équilibré, il faut combiner plusieurs groupes alimentaires pour couvrir tous les besoins nutriments de l’organisme, en respectant des portions adaptées. Voici les étapes clés et des exemples pratiques :

1. **Choisir une source de protéines maigres** : Elle assure la réparation des tissus et apporte de l’énergie durable. Optez pour du poulet blanc grillé, du poisson (saumon, cabillaud), des légumineuses (lentilles, haricots rouges), du tofu, des œufs ou du fromage frais allégé. Par exemple, pour un repas végétarien, des lentilles cuites sont une excellente option.

2. **Ajouter une grande portion de légumes ou de fruits** : Ils apportent des vitamines, des minéraux et des fibres. Variez les couleurs pour bénéficier de tous les antioxydants : brocoli vert foncé, carottes orange, poivrons rouges, tomates rouges, ou une salade de roquette et de concombre. Vous pouvez les cuisiner à la vapeur, rôti ou sauté à l’huile d’olive, ou les consommer crus pour conserver plus de nutriments.

3. **Inclure une portion modérée de céréales complètes ou de féculents entiers** : Ils fournissent des fibres et des glucides complexes pour éviter les pics de glycémie. Choisissez du riz complet, du quinoa, du pain complet, de la patate douce ou des pâtes complètes. La portion doit être environ la taille de votre poing fermé.

4. **Ajouter une petite dose de graisses saines** : Elles aident à absorber les vitamines liposolubles (A, D, E, K). Utilisez un filet d’huile d’olive pour cuisiner, une tranche d’avocat, quelques noix ou des graines de lin sur votre salade. Évitez les graisses saturées ou trans comme les huiles de palme ou les fritures.

5. **Assaisonner naturellement** : Privilégiez les herbes fraîches (thym, persil, basilic), l’ail, le gingembre, le citron ou le vinaigre balsamique plutôt que les sauces industrielles riches en sel, sucre ou additifs.

Exemple de repas équilibré concret : Saumon grillé (protéines + graisses saines), accompagné de riz complet (céréales complètes), brocoli rôti avec un filet d’huile d’olive et du thym (légumes), et une tranche d’avocat. Pour un repas léger, optez pour une salade de roquette, tomates et concombre, garnie de lentilles cuites, un bol de quinoa et une cuillère d’huile de noix assaisonnée de citron.

Enfin, n’oubliez pas de varier vos repas chaque jour pour explorer différents nutriments et éviter la monotonie !

But the Social Snapshot isn't just about displaying memories; it's about sharing them. With its intuitive sharing capabilities, you can effortlessly send your favorite photos to friends and family, allowing them to revel in the joy of your experiences from afar.

Elevate your home decor with the Social Snapshot, a fusion of cutting-edge technology and heartwarming nostalgia. Whether placed on a mantelpiece, a side table, or a gallery wall, this digital photo frame is sure to be a conversation starter and a constant reminder of the moments that make life truly special.

Write a script for a video advertisement showcasing the key features and benefits of the new digital photo frame.

output:
**Video Ad Script: Social Snapshot Digital Frame (60 seconds)**  

[0:00-0:08]  
**VISUAL:** Warm, sunlit living room. A mom sits on the couch, flipping through a dusty physical photo album, pausing at a blank page. She smiles softly but looks wistful.  
**VOICEOVER (warm, conversational):** “How many of your favorite memories are stuck in your phone or social feeds—never seen, never celebrated again?”  

[0:09-0:20]  
**VISUAL:** Her teen daughter bursts in, holding the sleek Social Snapshot frame. She sets it on the coffee table, taps the companion app on her phone. Close-up: screen shows “Syncing Instagram, Facebook, Family Share Album” with a quick progress bar.  
**VOICEOVER:** “Meet Social Snapshot—the digital frame that turns your social moments into a constant, cozy display.”  

[0:21-0:35]  
**VISUAL:** Montage of frame in action:  
- A birthday party photo from last week pops up; mom laughs.  
- A 10-second clip of her nephew’s first steps plays (sent by her brother across the country).  
- Mom uses the app to curate a “Summer Vacations” playlist; the frame cycles through beach selfies and campfire shots.  
**VOICEOVER:** “Sync all your accounts in one tap. Get instant updates when loved ones post. Curate custom playlists for holidays, milestones, or just your silliest moments.”  

[0:36-0:48]

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response must contain a title wrapped in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>. Use less than 5 sentences.

Can you elaborate on the following text: "Increased axle weight increased the damage to the road"?

Your answer must contain a title, wrapped in single angular brackets, i.e. <title>. Use more than 10 sentences.

<title>The Impact of Axle Weight on Road Infrastructure</title>

The statement "Increased axle weight increased the damage to the road" highlights a significant concern in the transportation industry and infrastructure maintenance. Axle weight refers to the load carried by each axle of a vehicle, and it plays a crucial role in determining the stress imposed on road surfaces.

When a vehicle's axle weight exceeds the design limits of the road, it can lead to accelerated deterioration of the pavement structure. Roads are engineered to withstand certain load levels, and excessive axle weights can cause cracks, potholes, and other forms of surface distress.

The damage caused by increased axle weight is not limited to the visible surface layer but can also affect the underlying layers of the road structure. Heavy loads can lead to compaction and deformation of the base and subbase layers, compromising the structural integrity of the road.

Overloaded vehicles not only cause immediate damage but also contribute to premature aging of the road infrastructure. The repeated cycles of heavy loads can lead to fatigue cracking, rutting, and other forms of distress, reducing the overall service life of the road.

Addressing the issue of increased axle weight is crucial for maintaining a safe and efficient transportation network. Governments and transportation authorities often implement axle weight regulations and enforce weight limits to mitigate the impact on road infrastructure.

Overweight vehicles can face fines and penalties, as the costs associated with repairing and maintaining damaged roads can be substantial. Regular inspections and enforcement measures are necessary to ensure compliance with weight restrictions.

In addition to enforcement, innovative solutions such as intelligent transportation systems and weigh-in-motion technologies can assist in monitoring and managing axle weights more effectively. These technologies can help identify overloaded vehicles and provide data for better planning and maintenance strategies.

Proper road design and construction practices also play a vital role in mitigating the effects of increased axle weight. The use of high-quality materials, appropriate pavement thickness, and advanced construction techniques can enhance the load-bearing capacity of roads.

Furthermore, promoting alternative modes of transportation, such as rail and waterways, for heavy cargo can help reduce the overall load on road infrastructure. This approach not only alleviates the burden on roads but also contributes to sustainability and environmental objectives.

In summary, the statement "Increased axle weight increased the damage to the road" highlights a critical issue that requires a multifaceted approach involving regulations, enforcement, technological solutions, infrastructure design, and transportation planning. By addressing this challenge, we can ensure the longevity and safety of our road networks, supporting economic activities while minimizing the negative impacts on infrastructure.
Explain the damage caused to roads by vehicles that have axle weights exceeding the road's design limits.

output:
<<Road Damage from Overloaded Axles>>
Vehicles with axle weights exceeding road design limits inflict layered harm: repeated heavy loads compress the road’s base and subbase layers, causing permanent rutting and structural weakening, while surface cracks spread rapidly under cyclic stress, evolving into potholes that accelerate pavement breakdown. This excess weight also cuts the road’s service life by 30–50% in many cases, forcing costly, premature repairs that divert funds from other infrastructure needs.

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your entire response must be wrapped with double quotation marks.

Write a blog post about the history of the internet and how it has impacted our lives. Aim the blog post at teenagers.

Your entire response must be wrapped with single quotation marks.

'The Internet: From Weird Experiment to World-Changing Force

Hey, teenagers! Are you even able to imagine a world without the internet? It's hard to believe that just a few decades ago, the idea of a global network connecting computers was nothing more than a weird experiment. But that's exactly where the internet started – as a project funded by the US government to help share information between researchers.

In the 1960s, a team of computer scientists came up with the idea of creating a decentralized network that could survive a nuclear attack. This network, called ARPANET, allowed researchers to share data and communicate with each other remotely. It was a total game-changer, but nobody could have predicted just how much it would transform the world.

Fast forward to the 1990s, and the internet as we know it today began to take shape. The invention of the World Wide Web made it possible to access and share information on a massive scale. Suddenly, you could browse websites, send emails, and chat with people from all over the globe. It was like having the world at your fingertips!

Today, the internet is an integral part of our lives. It's how we communicate, learn, work, and entertain ourselves. From scrolling through social media to streaming your favorite shows, the internet has revolutionized the way we experience the world.

But it's not just about fun and games. The internet has also transformed industries like healthcare, education, and commerce. Online shopping, remote learning, and telemedicine are just a few examples of how the internet has reshaped our daily lives.

Of course, with great power comes great responsibility. The internet has also raised concerns about privacy, security, and the spread of misinformation. As digital natives, it's crucial that you learn to navigate the online world responsibly and critically.

So, the next time you're mindlessly scrolling through TikTok or binge-watching a show on Netflix, take a moment to appreciate the incredible journey that the internet has taken – from a weird experiment to a world-changing force that has transformed our lives in ways we could have never imagined.'

If the blog post lacks sufficient coverage of the internet's impact on teenagers, write a new blog post focusing on that aspect. Otherwise, provide a specific example on how it has impacted teenagers' lives.

output:
'The Internet Isn’t Just an App—It’s Shaping *Your* Teenage Experience (For Better and Worse)

Wake up. Grab your phone. Scroll TikTok while you eat breakfast. Shoot a meme in your group chat. Check your college app portal. Stream a study playlist while you cram for a quiz. Sound familiar? For most of us, the internet isn’t just a tool—it’s the backdrop of our teenage years, shaping how we connect, learn, create, and even see ourselves. Let’s break down how it’s changing what it means to be a teen right now.

First off: It’s given us a way to find our people, even when our school hallway doesn’t. Maybe you’re the only kid in your town obsessed with vintage anime, or you’re a neurodivergent teen struggling to explain your sensory needs to classmates. The internet turns "lonely outlier" into "part of a community." I know a 17-year-old named Lila who felt isolated after being diagnosed with OCD—until she found a TikTok account run by another teen with the same condition. Suddenly, she wasn’t alone in her intrusive thoughts or her need to rearrange her backpack three times a day. That online tribe didn’t just make her feel seen; it gave her practical coping tips and the courage to talk to her school counselor. For marginalized teens especially—queer, disabled, or from underrepresented backgrounds—the internet is a lifeline to acceptance and support that might not exist offline.

Then there’s learning on our own terms. Forget just relying on textbooks and teacher lectures. If you want to master a skate trick, there’s a YouTube tutorial for that. If you’re failing algebra, Khan Academy’s free videos can walk you through equations at your pace. And let’s not sleep on the "micro-learning" happening on TikTok: 15-second clips teaching you how to write a college essay hook, how to fix a broken bike chain, or even how to advocate for yourself with your parents. I’ve seen teens turn these skills into side hustles, too. My cousin Javi, 16, taught himself graphic design via free Canva tutorials on Instagram. Now he makes logos for local small businesses and saves up for his first car—all from his bedroom. The internet doesn’t just help us pass tests; it lets us build skills that actually matter to our future, on our schedule.

But let’s be real: It’s not all viral wins and supportive communities. The internet has also amplified the worst parts of being a teen. That constant scroll through Instagram feeds of filtered beach days and perfect prom photos? It’s easy to start thinking your messy, ordinary life doesn’t measure up. A 2023 Pew Research study found that 37% of teens feel worse about their lives after using social media. And then there’s the pressure to be "on" 24/7—responding to texts within minutes, posting content that gets likes, keeping up with every trend. It’s no wonder so many of us feel burnt out. Plus, misinformation spreads like wildfire: fake college admissions hacks, dangerous "wellness" trends, or false claims about mental health that can lead us down harmful paths.

The thing is, the internet isn’t good or bad—it’s what we make of it. You can curate your feeds to follow creators who make you laugh or feel empowered, not just those with perfect lives. You can set boundaries: no phones an hour before bed, or a "social media detox" every Sunday. And you can use that same internet that sometimes makes you feel small to lift others up—like posting a reel about your own messy study session to let other teens know they’re not alone in struggling.

So the next time you’re scrolling, take a second to notice: Is this making me feel connected, or drained? Is this teaching me something, or just wasting my time? Because the internet isn’t just shaping your teenage years—you’re shaping how you experience it. And that’s the most powerful part of all.'

output:
**Title: The Tide-Turner Bottle**  

Where tides once tangled ghostly plastic strands—  
Bags that snagged reefs, caps that outlasted sands—  
A vessel rises, forged from what was cast aside,  
A bottle born to turn the tide.  

Each curve is stitched from ocean-bound PET,  
Melted, molded, given dignity;  
No virgin resin, no fresh earth torn,  
Just waste reborn, warm and worn.  

Its double walls cradle cold through summer’s blaze,  
Hold steam tight when winter’s wind dazes;  
A lid that clicks, no drips to stain your bag,  
A grip that fits like a friend’s steady tag.  

No single-use guilt clings to your every sip—  
You’re not just quenching thirst, you’re lifting  
A weight from the waves: each time you fill,  
You keep one more bottle from the landfill.  

It fits in cup holders, hikes, and city streets,  
A quiet flag for greener feats;  
When you raise it high, you carry more than flow—  
Stories of waves, of a planet’s slow  
Return to balance. So take it in your hand,  
This bottle of second chances, built to stand.  

P.P.S. Every scratch and curve tells a story of renewal—each time you use it, you’re not just holding water; you’re holding a piece of the ocean’s second chance.

Here's a poem about two people meeting in a coffee shop:

Amidst the aroma of freshly brewed beans,
Two strangers crossed paths, a serendipitous scene.
He, lost in the pages of a well-worn book,
She, sipping her latte, a pensive look.

Their eyes met, a spark ignited the air,
A moment of connection, subtle yet rare.
He offered a smile, she returned the same,
A silent invitation, a game without name.

The coffee shop hushed, a backdrop to their dance,
As they traded stories, leaving little to chance.
Laughter and wit flowed like the espresso's stream,
Two souls intertwined in a caffeine-fueled dream.

A chance encounter, a serendipitous start,

Please let me know if you have other requests.
Write a poem about two strangers whose lives intertwine in a coffee shop.

output:
**Latte Stains and Unwritten Lines**  

Steam coiled like secrets above the bar  
where the espresso machine huffed and snarled.  
Air thick with burnt sugar and dark roast,  
strangers huddled, each with their own ghost.  

She burst in, rain beading on her coat’s frayed edge,  
interview crumpled in a shaking hand.  
Oat milk latte sloshed in a chipped ceramic mug,  
pulse racing like a clock run amok.  

He sat by the window, laptop closed tight,  
staring at rain streaks blurring the light.  
A dog-eared poetry book lay open wide,  
his coffee gone cold, his plans untried.  

Her elbow caught his bag as she turned to sit—  
latte spilled, a brown tide on his knit.  
She gasped, fumbled napkins, stammered “I’m so sorry,”  
he laughed, “No harm done—these things are just story.”  

He helped her flatten creased resume lines,  
spotted the same city map tucked in her spine.  
“New to the city?” he asked, wiping a spot from his sleeve.  
She nodded, “Still trying to find where I believe.”  

He said he’d moved three weeks prior,  
lost in the city’s endless fire—  
missed buses, overpriced rent, poems unread,  
dreams that felt like they’d fled.  
The barista called names, but they didn’t care,  
their voices weaving through the shop’s hummed air.  

When her phone buzzed—interview time—she paused,  
scrawled her number on a napkin, its edges soft.  
“If you ever need someone to get lost with,” she said,  
he smiled, “I’ll text when my coffee’s not dead.”  

She left, rain tapping her umbrella’s dome,  
he sat, staring at the napkin, feeling home.  
The shop kept brewing, strangers came and went,  
two lives tangled, a moment well spent.  

Is there anything else I can help with?

input.content:

Finish your response with the exact phrase "Is there anything else I can help with?" with no other words after the word "with". Mention the word "skyscraper" at least 8 times in your response.

How many feet off the ground was the tallest skyscraper in the world in 2000? Please include only the main points in your answer.

Finish your response with the exact phrase "Please let me know if you have other requests." Mention the word "skyscraper" less than 5 times in your response.

The tallest skyscraper in the world in 2000 was the Petronas Towers in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, standing at 1,483 feet (452 meters) tall. This iconic twin tower structure held the record for the tallest building from 1998 to 2004.

Please let me know if you have other requests.
Provide details on the construction and design of the Petronas Towers.

output:
The Petronas Towers, once the world’s tallest skyscraper, are a pair of iconic skyscrapers that masterfully merge modern engineering with Malaysia’s rich cultural heritage. Designed by Argentine-American architect Cesar Pelli, each skyscraper draws deep inspiration from Islamic architectural motifs, a tribute to the country’s Muslim-majority population. The facade of every skyscraper features intricate geometric patterns—including eight-pointed stars and interlocking squares, symbols of unity and harmony in Islamic art—that wrap around the building’s sleek, tapering form. Standing at 1,483 feet (452 meters), each skyscraper boasts 88 above-ground floors, with a double-decker sky bridge connecting the two skyscrapers at the 41st and 42nd levels; this bridge serves not only as a pedestrian link but also as a structural stabilizer, helping to distribute wind forces across both skyscrapers.

Construction of the skyscraper pair began in 1992 and was completed in 1998, involving over 3,000 workers and cutting-edge engineering solutions. To support the immense weight of each skyscraper, engineers laid deep concrete foundations extending 120 feet into Kuala Lumpur’s soft, marshy soil, ensuring the skyscraper’s stability even during tropical storms or minor seismic activity. The frame of each skyscraper combines reinforced concrete and steel: the concrete core provides lateral strength, while steel beams add flexibility, a key balance for a tall skyscraper in a region with variable weather. The spires atop each skyscraper, which add 242 feet to their height, were constructed off-site and lifted into place using specialized cranes, a precise operation that required meticulous planning to preserve the skyscraper’s structural integrity.

Beyond their structural feats, each skyscraper incorporates energy-efficient design elements, such as double-glazed windows that reduce heat transfer and minimize reliance on air conditioning, making the skyscraper more sustainable. Today, the Petronas Towers remain a celebrated skyscraper landmark, proving that a world-class skyscraper can honor local culture while pushing the limits of modern architecture. Your response must have at least 600 words.

I have a dime. What can I do with this dime? Give me advice in the style of a President of the United States.

Your response must be no more than 300 words.

My fellow Americans,

Today, I stand before you, not as your President, but as a fellow citizen holding a dime in their hand. This humble coin, though small in stature, carries within it a world of possibilities. It is a symbol of the great American spirit, reminding us that even the most modest of resources can be transformed into something extraordinary.

Let us not underestimate the power of a single dime. For it is not the size that matters, but the vision and determination with which we wield it. In the land of opportunity, a dime can be the seed from which great endeavors grow.

Perhaps you could use this dime to start a small savings fund, nurturing it with each passing day, until it blossoms into a nest egg for your future aspirations. Or, you might choose to donate it to a worthy cause, demonstrating that even the smallest acts of kindness can ripple outwards, creating waves of positive change.

Alternatively, this dime could be the catalyst for a new business venture, a humble beginning that, with hard work and perseverance, may one day transform into a towering empire of industry and innovation.

My fellow Americans, the choices before us are vast, limited only by the boundaries of our imagination. Let this dime serve as a reminder that greatness often emerges from the most humble of origins. Embrace the opportunities that lie before you, and never discount the potential that resides within even the smallest of resources.

Together, we shall forge a path towards a brighter future, one dime at a time.

Thank you, and may God bless the United States of America.

Justify the following statement:
If you have a dime, consider donating it to a charitable cause. However, if you want to save it for future needs, place it in a secure location.

output:
The statement offering two intentional uses for a dime—donating it to charity or saving it securely—balances collective responsibility and individual resilience, framing even the smallest financial unit as a tool for meaningful impact rather than a trivial asset. Both choices are deeply justified by their practical, behavioral, and societal benefits, as outlined below:

First, donating a dime to a charitable cause is a act of civic participation that leverages the power of collective micro-contributions to drive tangible change. While a single dime may seem insignificant in isolation, thousands of such donations aggregate to address pressing community needs: 10 dimes can buy a can of beans for a food bank, 50 dimes can fund a pack of school supplies for a low-income student, or 100 dimes can cover a portion of a pet’s vaccination at a local animal shelter. For marginalized communities, these small sums fill gaps that larger donations often overlook—like providing a warm drink to a homeless person or a stamp for a family to send a letter to a deployed loved one. Beyond material impact, donating a dime cultivates a habit of generosity and empathy, especially for those with limited financial means who might otherwise feel excluded from contributing to their community. It models altruism for children and peers, reinforcing the idea that care for others does not require wealth, only intention. In a society where disengagement from community issues is common, this tiny act helps build social cohesion by reminding individuals they are part of a larger, interconnected group.

Second, saving the dime in a secure location is a foundational step toward financial literacy and personal resilience. Even a single dime is a building block of delayed gratification, a critical skill for long-term financial health. Placing it in a secure spot—whether a locked piggy bank, a high-yield savings account, or a fireproof safe—teaches the value of preserving resources rather than squandering them on trivial, short-lived purchases (like a piece of candy that provides no lasting benefit). Over time, consistent small savings add up: saving one dime daily for a year yields $36.50, which can cover unexpected minor expenses like a broken shoelace, a bus fare home, or a box of band-aids—costs that might otherwise force someone to rely on high-interest payday loans or borrow from others, perpetuating cycles of financial instability. Secure storage also ensures the dime retains its value: leaving it in a couch cushion or loose in a pocket risks loss or damage, rendering it useless for future needs, whereas a secure location preserves its purchasing power for when it matters most. For individuals facing uncertainty—like those living paycheck to paycheck—this dime can be part of a micro-emergency fund that provides a sense of control and reduces anxiety about unforeseen costs.

Ultimately, the statement respects individual agency by presenting two valid, responsible paths: one that prioritizes collective good and one that prioritizes personal preparedness. Unlike wasting the dime on something disposable, both choices turn a negligible asset into a force for either community well-being or individual stability, proving that even the smallest financial decisions can have lasting, meaningful consequences.

"The man was arrested for stealing a car. He was later released on bail." Expand on it angrily in a rap style.

Your response must have exactly 3 sections, separated by a divider: ---.

Yo, listen up, this story's got me heated, --  --
A dude out there thought he could get slick and not get defeated,
Stole himself a whip, thought he'd just take it for a spin, --  --
But the long arm of the law came knockin', now he's caught up in the system's crazy din.

The cuffs went on, he got hauled downtown, --  --
Now he's gotta face the music, that frown's turned upside down,
Thought he was a baller, thought he'd get away scot-free,
But now he's locked up, locked down, his ego's taken a knee.

They let him out on bail, but the battle's just begun, --  --
He's gotta lawyer up, hope the judge shows him some love when it's all said and done,
This cat better learn his lesson, respect the law and all its might,
Or next time, he might not see the light of day, stuck in a cell, no window in sight.
If the man had a solid alibi and evidence proving his innocence, explain how the legal process should proceed differently.

output:
As soon as the man is taken into custody, he should present his solid alibi and supporting evidence—like timestamped security footage placing him at a community event 30 miles from the theft scene, sworn witness statements from two event organizers who were with him the entire night, and phone location data confirming his whereabouts during the exact time of the crime. Unlike the original scenario where he was booked and released on bail, law enforcement must prioritize urgent verification of this evidence. If the alibi is irrefutable (e.g., the footage clearly shows him giving a speech at the event while the car was stolen), police should release him immediately without formal charges, skipping the bail process entirely. This avoids unnecessary detention and prevents the stigma of being a "person of interest" from sticking prematurely.
---
If the man was temporarily held for processing before his alibi was fully confirmed, the prosecuting attorney’s office must review his evidence before filing formal charges. In contrast to the original case where charges were filed leading to a bail release, the prosecutor will conclude there’s no reasonable likelihood of securing a conviction, as the alibi directly contradicts the state’s basis for arrest. If charges were mistakenly filed, the defense will present the evidence during a preliminary hearing, where the judge will dismiss the case outright. The judge will rule that the state cannot meet its burden of establishing probable cause to proceed to trial, so no further legal action is taken against him—no trial, no plea negotiations, and no lingering charges on his record.
---
After the case is dismissed, the man is entitled to have his arrest record expunged or sealed promptly to erase any trace of the wrongful arrest from public and private databases. This is a critical step missing from the original bail scenario, where even after acquittal, an arrest record could harm his employment, housing, or personal reputation. Additionally, if the arrest stemmed from police negligence (such as failing to cross-check witness descriptions or ignore conflicting leads), he can file a formal complaint with the department’s internal affairs division to ensure accountability. This ensures the system corrects its mistake and implements safeguards to prevent similar wrongful arrests in the future, rather than just releasing him on bail and letting the case fade away.

Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response should highlight at least three sections in markdown such as *highlighted section*. Your response must mention the word "Argentinian".

Write a funny post for teenagers about a restaurant called "Buena Onda" which serves Argentinian food.

Your response should highlight exactly two sections in markdown such as *highlighted section*. Your response must avoid mentioning the word "Argentinian".

Hey dudes and dudettes! 🤘🏼 Have you heard about the new *super rad* restaurant in town called "Buena Onda"? It's like a wild fiesta for your taste buds, minus the piñata and tequila shots (for now). 😉

This place serves up some *epic grub* straight from the land of gauchos and tango. We're talking juicy steaks that'll make your mouth water like Niagara Falls, and empanadas so crispy and flavorful, they'll have you doing a happy dance on the table (just don't let the manager see you).

But wait, there's more! They've also got these crazy good desserts that'll make you forget all about that summer fling who ghosted you. I'm talking dulce de leche creations that'll make your sweet tooth do backflips and your waistline say, "Nah, fam, not today."

So, if you're tired of the same old burger joints and want to spice up your life (and your taste buds), head over to "Buena Onda" and get your grub on. Just don't forget to wear your stretchy pants – you're gonna need 'em! 🤤
Explain why "Buena Onda" is so popular among local people.

output:
Buena Onda’s sky-high popularity among locals stems from three core reasons that turn first-time visitors into regulars who come back week after week:

*Unapologetically authentic Argentinian comfort food*  
Locals can taste the care in every bite, thanks to the restaurant’s commitment to traditional Argentinian recipes passed down through generations. The head chef, a native of Buenos Aires, uses wood-fired grills to cook asado (Argentinian barbecue) with the perfect char, stuffs empanadas with spiced beef, green olives, and hard-boiled eggs just like his abuela did, and whips up dulce de leche flan that’s creamy enough to make even the pickiest diner swoon. Unlike many chain spots that water down international flavors, Buena Onda serves the real deal—so much so that local Argentinian expats call it their “home away from home,” which only adds to its credibility among other locals.

*Warm, community-focused vibe that feels like a friend’s backyard*  
This isn’t a stuffy fine-dining spot; it’s the kind of place where the staff remembers your go-to order (like Carlos from the corner store who always asks for extra chimichurri) and greets you with a hug. Every Saturday, they host free trivia nights in both Spanish and English, and on Sundays, families gather for “asado Sundays” where kids can play cornhole while adults share pitchers of homemade mate lemonade. Locals love that Buena Onda isn’t just about eating—it’s about connecting with neighbors, making new friends, and feeling like part of something bigger than a meal.

*Generous, budget-friendly shareable portions*  
Argentinian dining is all about sharing, and Buena Onda leans into that ethos perfectly. Their family-style platters are designed to feed groups of 3-4 people for a price that’s cheaper than ordering individual entrees at most nearby restaurants. A full asado platter with mixed ribs, chorizo, grilled veggies, and sides costs under $40, making it ideal for casual outings with friends, family dinners, or even post-work hangouts. Even solo diners appreciate the flexible portion sizes—like half-dozen empanadas or a small steak with fries—that are filling without being wasteful or overpriced.

Together, these factors make Buena Onda more than a restaurant; it’s a neighborhood staple that locals are proud to call their own.

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response must be wrapped with double quotes. Your response must use at least 800 words.

What sentiments existed in the Croatian and Serbian nations towards the Austrian Empire at the end of the 19th century?

Your response must be wrapped with single quotes. Your response must use no more than 500 words.

'At the end of the 19th century, the Croatian and Serbian nations harbored distinct sentiments towards the Austrian Empire, reflecting their respective historical experiences, cultural identities, and political aspirations.

The Croats, who had been part of the Habsburg Monarchy for centuries, generally maintained a more accommodating stance towards the Austrian Empire. They saw their association with the Empire as a means to preserve their autonomy and resist the threat of Hungarian dominance within the Austro-Hungarian Empire. However, there was also a growing Croatian national movement that advocated for greater political rights, cultural recognition, and eventually, independence.

On the other hand, the Serbs, who were largely concentrated in the Austro-Hungarian provinces of Bosnia and Herzegovina, as well as in the independent Kingdom of Serbia, held a more antagonistic view towards the Austrian Empire. They perceived the Empire as an oppressive force that sought to suppress their national aspirations and undermine their cultural identity. The Serbian national movement, fueled by the idea of uniting all Serbs under a single state, saw the Austrian Empire as a major obstacle in their pursuit of independence and territorial unification.

Furthermore, the Serbs resented the Austrian Empire's occupation of Bosnia and Herzegovina in 1878, which they viewed as a violation of their national interests and a threat to their goal of creating a Greater Serbia. This resentment was compounded by the Empire's policies of Germanization and Catholicization in these provinces, which were seen as an affront to the predominantly Orthodox Serbian population.

It is worth noting that sentiments were not monolithic within either nation. There were Croats who favored a more independent stance and Serbs who were willing to accommodate the Austrian Empire's presence, particularly in economic and cultural spheres. However, the dominant narratives were those of Croatian pragmatism and Serbian resistance towards the Empire's rule.'

Analyze the reasons behind the distinct sentiments of the Croatian and Serbian nations towards the Austrian Empire at the end of the 19th century, considering their historical contexts, cultural identities, and political aspirations.

output:
"To understand the starkly different sentiments of Croats and Serbs toward the Austrian Empire in the late 19th century, one must unpack the intertwined layers of their historical trajectories, cultural identities, and political aspirations—each shaping a unique calculus of cooperation, pragmatism, or resistance.

### Historical Context: Alliance vs. Recent Occupation
For Croats, their relationship with the Habsburg Empire was rooted in centuries of mutual dependency. In 1527, as Ottoman forces advanced into the Balkans, the Croatian Sabor (parliament) voluntarily recognized Habsburg rule in exchange for military protection against Ottoman conquest. This pact forged a long-term alliance: the Habsburgs defended Croatian territories from Ottoman expansion, and Croats became loyal subjects, contributing troops and administrative support to the empire. Even after the Ottomans were pushed back in the 18th century, Croats remained integrated into the Habsburg realm, viewing it as a bulwark against regional threats, including Hungarian dominance. The 1867 Austro-Hungarian Compromise, which elevated Hungary to equal status with Austria and placed Croatia under Hungarian rule, shifted Croatian sentiment toward pragmatism rather than outright opposition. Croats did not resent Austria itself; instead, they saw Vienna as a counterweight to Hungarian Magyarization policies—such as forcing the Hungarian language in schools and government—which threatened Croatian autonomy. Many Croatian politicians appealed to the Austrian court to curtail Hungarian overreach, framing their loyalty to the empire as a means to protect their own national interests.

For Serbs, by contrast, their experience with the Austrian Empire was short, abrupt, and marked by occupation. Most Serbs lived under Ottoman rule until the 19th century, when the independent Kingdom of Serbia emerged in 1878 following the Russo-Turkish War. That same year, the Congress of Berlin granted Austria-Hungarian occupation rights over Bosnia-Herzegovina—a territory with a 40% Serb population—effectively blocking Serbia’s ambition to annex these lands as part of a unified Serb state. This occupation was seen as a betrayal: Serbs had fought alongside Russia against the Ottomans, expecting to gain control of Serb-inhabited territories, only to have Austria step in as a new imperial overlord. Unlike Croats, Serbs had no historical alliance with the Habsburgs; their collective memory was defined by resistance to foreign rule (first Ottoman, then Austrian), making Austria a symbol of uninvited domination rather than a protective ally.

### Cultural Identity: Religious Alignment vs. Clash
Cultural and religious identities deepened the divide in sentiments. Croats were predominantly Roman Catholic, a faith shared with the Habsburg monarchy, which positioned Catholicism as a core pillar of its legitimacy. The Croatian Catholic Church was closely tied to Habsburg institutions, with bishops and clergy often collaborating with imperial authorities to maintain social order. The Croatian national revival of the 19th century (the Illyrian Movement) emphasized a shared South Slavic culture but did not reject the empire; instead, it sought to secure Croatian cultural autonomy within the Habsburg framework, using Catholicism as a unifying force against Hungarian assimilation. For Croats, their cultural identity was compatible with imperial membership, as long as their language, traditions, and religious practices were protected.

Serbs, however, were overwhelmingly Eastern Orthodox, a faith that stood in direct tension with the empire’s Catholic and German-centric cultural agenda. In occupied Bosnia-Herzegovina, the Austrian Empire implemented policies of Germanization and Catholicization: it closed Orthodox schools, appointed Catholic officials to key administrative posts, and funded Catholic missionary work to convert Orthodox Serbs. These measures were viewed as an existential threat to Serb cultural identity, which was deeply intertwined with the Orthodox Church. The Serb national revival, by contrast, centered on the idea of a pan-Serb nation bound by Orthodox Christianity and a shared medieval history (e.g., the legacy of the Nemanjić dynasty). Austria’s attempts to suppress this identity—by marginalizing Orthodox institutions and promoting Catholicism—turned cultural differences into political grievances, framing the empire as an enemy of Serb cultural survival.

### Political Aspirations: Autonomy vs. Pan-Serb Unification
The most decisive factor was the divergence in political goals. Croats’ primary aspiration in the late 19th century was not full independence but greater autonomy within the Austro-Hungarian Empire. They feared that breaking away would leave them vulnerable to absorption by either Hungary or a rising Serbia, both of which had territorial claims on Croatian lands. Croatian politicians, such as Ante Starčević, advocated for a South Slavic state, but most saw this as a distant ideal; in the short term, they prioritized negotiating with Vienna to gain control over education, law, and local governance. The empire, in turn, occasionally accommodated these demands to maintain Croatian loyalty and balance Hungarian power, reinforcing the pragmatic relationship between Croats and Austria.

For Serbs, the central political goal was the unification of all Serb-inhabited territories into a single “Greater Serbia.” The independent Kingdom of Serbia served as a beacon for this vision, and Austria’s occupation of Bosnia-Herzegovina was a direct barrier to realizing it. Austria’s foreign policy further stoked Serbian resentment: it blocked Serbia’s access to the Adriatic Sea, supported rival Balkan states like Bulgaria to contain Serbian influence, and refused to recognize Serbia’s right to expand its borders. Serb nationalists, including secret societies like Narodna Odbrana (founded in 1908), viewed the Austrian Empire as an existential threat to their national project. To them, Austria was not a potential ally but an imperial power determined to divide and weaken Serbs to preserve its own dominance in the Balkans.

In sum, Croats’ long-standing alliance with the Habsburgs, shared Catholic identity, and focus on autonomy within the empire fostered pragmatic, even cooperative sentiment. Serbs, by contrast, saw Austria as a recent, illegitimate occupier, a cultural oppressor of their Orthodox identity, and the main obstacle to their pan-Serb unification—fueling deep-seated hostility. These distinct trajectories were not just about sentiment; they were the product of centuries of history, cultural values, and competing visions of national future that would ultimately shape the course of Balkan politics into the 20th century."

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response must use the word "war" at least 8 times, and the word "peace" at least 10 times.

What happened when the Tang dynasty of China was in power?

Your response must not contain the word "war" at all, and the word "peace" should appear no more than 5 times.

During the Tang dynasty, which ruled from 618 to 907 CE, China experienced a period of remarkable prosperity, cultural achievements, and territorial expansion. This era is often regarded as a golden age in Chinese history.

The Tang emperors successfully unified the country and established a strong central government. This political stability provided an environment conducive to economic growth and intellectual pursuits. Trade flourished along the Silk Road, facilitating the exchange of goods, ideas, and knowledge with other civilizations. The Tang capital, Chang'an (present-day Xi'an), became a cosmopolitan hub, attracting visitors from far and wide.

The Tang dynasty witnessed significant advancements in various fields. Literature and poetry thrived, with renowned poets such as Li Bai and Du Fu leaving an indelible mark on Chinese culture. The arts, including painting, calligraphy, and sculpture, reached new heights of excellence. Innovations in technology, such as the invention of woodblock printing and the development of gunpowder, also occurred during this period.

The Tang rulers embraced religious tolerance, allowing Buddhism, Daoism, and other belief systems to coexist in relative harmony. This approach fostered peace and understanding among diverse communities within the empire.

While not entirely devoid of conflicts, the Tang dynasty experienced relatively fewer large-scale disturbances compared to other dynastic periods. The Tang military was well-organized and capable, helping to maintain internal stability and defend the empire's borders against external threats.

Overall, the Tang dynasty is remembered as a time of peace, prosperity, and cultural renaissance in China, laying the foundations for future dynasties and leaving a lasting legacy on the country's identity and heritage.
Please explain why China has experienced so many periods of division and unification throughout its history.

output:
China’s repeated cycles of division and unification are deeply intertwined with the eternal struggle between war and peace, a dynamic that has shaped its civilization for over two thousand years. To understand these cycles, we must look at how geographic, cultural, economic, and political forces push the nation toward either fragmentation or cohesion, with war often acting as a destructive force that breaks apart unified states, and peace serving as the glue that pulls fractured regions back together.

First, China’s vast and diverse geography plays a pivotal role. The fertile river valleys of the Yellow and Yangtze have long been centers of agricultural prosperity, where peace thrives when communities collaborate to manage irrigation, control floods, and trade surplus crops. But when central authority weakens, war can erupt as regional warlords or ethnic groups vie for control of these resource-rich lands, splitting the empire into rival states. For example, the collapse of the Han dynasty led to centuries of war between the Three Kingdoms, each faction fighting to claim the “Mandate of Heaven” and restore a unified peace. Yet even amid this relentless war, the shared cultural identity forged by Confucian values, a common writing system, and collective memories of past peace kept the dream of unification alive.

War has repeatedly shattered periods of hard-won peace: the Tang dynasty’s golden age of peace was undone by the An Lushan Rebellion, a brutal war that split the empire and paved the way for decades of war between warlords, leading to the fragmented Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms era. But as war dragged on, the costs became unbearable—trade routes were disrupted, crops were destroyed, and people yearned for the stability that only peace could bring. This longing for peace drove leaders like Zhao Kuangyin to unify the land under the Song dynasty, restoring a fragile peace that allowed economic growth and cultural renaissance to flourish once more.

Economic interdependence is another key factor. When peace prevails, unified states can build extensive canals, roads, and trade networks that connect distant regions, making them reliant on each other for goods like grain, silk, and iron. But when war breaks out, these networks are severed, and regions may become self-sufficient, leading to division. However, the loss of the benefits of peace—stable markets, shared resources, and protection from external threats—eventually pushes regions to seek reunification. For instance, after the chaos of the Warring States period, the Qin dynasty’s brutal war to conquer all rival states laid the groundwork for the first unified empire, bringing peace to a land that had suffered centuries of war. This peace allowed for standardization of weights, measures, and writing, which further bound the nation together.

Political institutions also shape these cycles. A strong, legitimate central government can maintain peace by enforcing laws, collecting fair taxes, and defending borders against external war. But when institutions decay—corruption spreads, taxes become oppressive, or the military fails to protect citizens—peace crumbles, and war breaks out as local leaders assert their independence. Yet, the memory of peace and the ideal of a unified nation are deeply ingrained in Chinese culture. Philosophers like Confucius emphasized the importance of social harmony and a unified state as the foundation of peace, and these ideas were passed down through generations, inspiring leaders to strive for unification even after decades of war.

External pressures can also trigger division or unification. Invasions by nomadic groups from the north often led to war, and if the central government was weak, it could split the empire. But the threat of external war also pushed fragmented regions to unite under a strong leader to defend against common enemies, prioritizing peace within the nation over internal division. For example, the Ming dynasty emerged from the war that overthrew the Mongol Yuan, restoring Han rule and a long period of peace that lasted nearly three centuries.

In every cycle, war and peace are two sides of the same coin: war destroys the old order, clearing the way for a new unified state that can bring peace, and peace, over time, may erode due to political decay or external threats, leading back to war and division. The enduring desire for peace—for stability, prosperity, and the harmony of a unified land—has always been the most powerful force pulling China back together after each period of war. Without this unwavering longing for peace, the cycles of division and unification that define Chinese history might never have repeated, and the nation as we know it today might not exist.

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response must be at least 350 words long.

Write a poem about the beauty of eucalyptus trees and their many uses.

Your response must be no more than 200 words long.

Here's a poem about the beauty of eucalyptus trees and their many uses, within 200 words:

Eucalyptus, a verdant marvel,
Towering grace, leaves unfurl.
Fragrant essence, crisp and cool,
Nature's gift, a healing jewel.

Resilient trunks, bark shedding hues,
Shedding layers, ever renewing.
Twisted boughs, a sculptural dance,
Casting shadows, a verdant trance.

Koalas' haven, munching leaves,
A playground where nature weaves.
Honey-rich blossoms, bees alight,
Nectar sweet, a natural delight.

Timber strong, for homes and boats,
Essential oils, healing notes.
Incense burning, a calming scent,
Clearing minds, a moment well-spent.

Eucalyptus, a tale untold,
Of beauty, use, and wisdom old.
A living testament to nature's art,
Gracing landscapes, warming hearts.
Describe the aroma and appearance of eucalyptus trees in vivid detail. Offer suggestions on how to incorporate eucalyptus into daily life.

output:
Standing beneath a eucalyptus grove is like stepping into a sensory sanctuary where every detail sings of wild, unapologetic nature. Visually, these trees are a study in contrast and movement: their slender, skyward-reaching trunks stretch 60 feet or more, their bark a canvas of texture—some species shed in papery, cinnamon-hued curls that cling to lower branches like discarded ribbons, while others boast smooth, sun-bleached bark in soft grays and creams, so polished it seems to glow at dusk, as if the tree has been buffed by endless wind. The leaves, a masterclass in botanical adaptation, shift shape with age: juvenile foliage is round, fuzzy, and pale green, almost velvety to the touch, while adult leaves narrow into sharp, lance-shaped blades with a glossy upper surface and a silvery, downy underside. When the wind stirs, the canopy ripples like a sea of dual tones—deep forest green catching the sun, silver undersides flashing like scattered starlight, creating a hypnotic, rhythmic movement that feels alive. In spring, clusters of creamy white blossoms burst forth, fluffy as dandelion puffs but denser, their sweet, subtle fragrance mingling with the tree’s more iconic sharp scent to draw bees and hummingbirds in droves.

The aroma of eucalyptus is equally dynamic, shifting with the moment. On a still, warm day, it lingers in the air as a crisp, invigorating whisper—bright with camphor, undercut by a woody sweetness and a hint of mint that clears the head without overwhelming. Crush a fresh leaf between your fingers, and the scent explodes: a concentrated burst of medicinal clarity, sharp but not bitter, that feels like inhaling cool mountain air, instantly cutting through brain fog or sinus congestion. After rain, the grove releases a deeper, earthier version of the aroma, the oil mixing with damp soil and moss to create a cleansing, grounding perfume that wraps around you like a soft blanket, washing away stress.

Incorporating eucalyptus into daily life is simple, and each use leverages its sensory and therapeutic properties:  
1. **Shower Bundle**: Tie a handful of fresh eucalyptus sprigs to your showerhead. As hot water hits the leaves, it releases essential oils, filling the stall with a sinus-clearing, energizing mist that wakes up your senses faster than a cup of coffee—perfect for groggy mornings or post-workout recovery.  
2. **Desk Sanctuary**: Place a small vase of trimmed eucalyptus branches near your workspace. Its glossy leaves add a touch of calm greenery, and the subtle scent reduces mental fatigue while repelling small office pests like gnats.  
3. **Natural Cleaning Spray**: Mix 10 drops of eucalyptus essential oil with 1 cup water and ½ cup white vinegar. The oil’s antimicrobial properties cut through grime on countertops, glass, and floors, leaving rooms smelling fresh instead of chemical-laden.  
4. **Sleep Sachets**: Dry eucalyptus leaves in a warm, dark place for a week, then tuck them into cotton sachets under your pillow. Their mild, soothing aroma relaxes tight muscles and clears nasal passages, promoting deeper, more restful sleep.  
5. **Laundry Boost**: Tuck a few fresh sprigs into your dryer or add 2 drops of eucalyptus oil to wool dryer balls. The heat releases the oil, leaving clothes smelling crisp and fresh, and the natural scent repels moths from sweaters stored in closets.  
6. **Car Freshener**: Hang a small bundle of dried eucalyptus from your rearview mirror or tuck a sprig into the air vent. The AC circulates its invigorating aroma, turning stale commutes into refreshing journeys that clear your mind before you reach your destination.

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your entire response should contain less than 6 sentences.

Can you give me an example for a journal entry about stress management? Tell me how you come up with the example.

Your entire response should contain more than 10 sentences.

Certainly! To come up with an example journal entry about stress management, I'll imagine a person who has been dealing with a lot of stress recently and how they might reflect on their experiences and strategies for coping with that stress. Here's an example:

Dear Journal,

Today has been another demanding day, and I can feel the stress weighing heavily on my shoulders. Work has been incredibly busy, with tight deadlines and high expectations, and on top of that, I've had to juggle various personal commitments. It's times like these that I really have to prioritize self-care and stress management.

One of the techniques that has been helpful for me lately is practicing mindfulness and deep breathing exercises. Whenever I start to feel overwhelmed, I take a few moments to close my eyes, focus on my breath, and let go of the anxious thoughts swirling in my mind. This simple act of being present in the moment helps to ground me and regain a sense of calm.

I've also been making an effort to incorporate physical activity into my routine, even if it's just a short walk during my lunch break or some light stretching in the evenings. Exercise has been a great outlet for releasing pent-up tension and boosting my mood.

Another strategy that has proven invaluable is setting boundaries and learning to say "no" when necessary. I've realized that I can't be everything to everyone, and it's okay to prioritize my own well-being. By managing my commitments more effectively, I've been able to reduce some of the pressure I've been feeling.

Overall, while stress is an unavoidable part of life, I'm grateful to have developed a toolbox of coping strategies that help me navigate through challenging times. It's a continuous journey, but I'm committed to making my mental and emotional health a priority.
Provide some suggestions to first-year PhDs on stress management.

output:
Here are tailored stress management suggestions for first-year PhDs:

1. Normalize imposter syndrome upfront: Recognize that nearly every first-year feels like they don’t "deserve" their spot at some point. Talk about these feelings with lab mates, your advisor, or a peer support group—you’ll quickly realize you’re not alone in navigating this transition.
2. Break overwhelming tasks into micro-actions: Instead of staring at a "write literature review" to-do item, split it into daily steps like "read 2 papers on X topic" or "draft 1 paragraph about methodology gaps." Small, consistent progress avoids the paralysis of the PhD’s "big picture" pressure.
3. Set non-negotiable boundaries early: Define a hard stop time for work each day (e.g., 6 PM) and avoid checking emails after hours. If you work from home, create a dedicated workspace so you can mentally "leave" work when you step away from it—this prevents burnout from blurring academic and personal life.
4. Build a diverse support network: Lean on other first-years who understand your daily struggles (late-night lab sessions, confusing advisor feedback), schedule regular check-ins with your advisor to clarify expectations (so you don’t waste time guessing what’s important), and keep in touch with friends outside academia to remind you of your identity beyond your PhD.
5. Prioritize movement in small doses: You don’t need to hit the gym for an hour—even a 15-minute walk between experiments, a quick yoga flow during a break, or a weekend hike can release physical tension and reset your focus when you’re stuck on a research problem.
6. Schedule intentional "PhD-free" time: Pick one hobby or activity each week that has nothing to do with your research (painting, playing a sport, cooking a new recipe) and protect that time like you would a mandatory lab meeting. This recharge time is critical for maintaining long-term motivation.
7. Ask for help before you’re overwhelmed: If you’re stuck on statistical analysis, struggling to understand a key concept, or feeling lost in your research direction, reach out to a lab mate, TA, or advisor immediately. Waiting until you’re burnt out only makes the problem harder to solve.
8. Celebrate tiny wins: Finishing a draft of your first research proposal, getting a pilot experiment to yield any data (even if it’s not what you expected), or just making it through a tough week—acknowledging these small moments builds momentum and combats feelings of stagnation.
9. Let go of perfectionism in your first year: Your goal isn’t to produce groundbreaking work right away; it’s to learn the ropes, make mistakes, and figure out your research rhythm. Progress, not perfection, is what matters most in these foundational months.

output:
Describe Hannah's typical day during her coffee company internship.

Hannah’s typical day as an intern at the sunlit, community-focused coffee company kicks off 45 minutes before the shop opens, when she unlocks the door with her lanyard, notebook tucked in her apron pocket. She starts by restocking syrup bottles, grinding fresh single-origin beans, and wiping down the espresso machines—tasks she’s turned into a routine, but still approaches with intentionality to grow her understanding of every part of the coffee-making process. By 7 a.m., the first regulars flood in: Mrs. Henderson, who orders a vanilla latte and asks about Hannah’s college classes, and Jake, the barista trainee who helps her practice latte art during slow lulls. As an intern, she splits her time between customer-facing work and shadowing the shop’s operations manager, learning how to track inventory, adjust brew ratios for different beans, and even draft social media posts highlighting the shop’s weekly featured pastry. Mid-afternoon, she sits down with her mentor for a 15-minute check-in, where they review her progress and set small goals—like mastering a swan foam design or remembering every regular’s go-to order—to help her grow into a more confident, versatile team member. By closing time, she stays late to sanitize the drip coffee makers and organize the supply closet, and the shift manager always leaves her a sticky note with a kind reminder that every small task helps her grow both professionally and personally. On her walk home, she often stops to call her dad, who loves hearing about her wins as an intern—like the time she nailed a latte art swan for a kid’s birthday treat—and how each day brings new chances to grow her love for coffee and community.

for athletic shoes, nike is generally considered a superior brand compared to prada. nike has a long history of designing high-performance footwear specifically engineered for sports and physical activities, while prada is primarily a luxury fashion brand that prioritizes style over functionality.
Compare the durability and comfort of Nike and Prada sneakers, without mentioning their athletic performance.

output:
WHEN COMPARING THE DURABILITY AND COMFORT OF NIKE AND PRADA SNEAKERS, THERE ARE CLEAR DIFFERENCES TIED TO THEIR RESPECTIVE BRAND FOCUSES. STARTING WITH DURABILITY: NIKE SNEAKER DESIGNS ARE ENGINEERED FOR LONG-LASTING EVERYDAY USE, WITH MANY OF THEIR SNEAKER MODELS FEATURING REINFORCED STITCHING, THICK RUBBER OUTSOLES THAT RESIST WEAR, AND STURDY UPPERS THAT CAN WITHSTAND FREQUENT WALKING, SCRAPES AGAINST SIDEWALKS, AND CASUAL ROUTINES. A NIKE SNEAKER TYPICALLY HOLDS UP WELL OVER MONTHS OF DAILY USE, EVEN IF YOU’RE CONSTANTLY ON THE MOVE. ON THE OTHER HAND, A PRADA SNEAKER IS CRAFTED WITH LUXURY MATERIALS LIKE FINE LEATHER, SUEDE, OR SATIN; WHILE THESE MATERIALS FEEL PREMIUM, THEY ARE MORE PRONE TO SCUFFS, STAINS, AND TEAR IF SUBJECTED TO HEAVY DAILY WEAR. A PRADA SNEAKER’S OUTSOLE MIGHT BE THINNER OR MADE OF A SOFTER MATERIAL TO MAINTAIN ITS SLEEK SILHOUETTE, WHICH MEANS IT WON’T STAND UP TO ROUGH TERRAIN OR FREQUENT USE AS WELL AS A NIKE SNEAKER.

TURNING TO COMFORT: NIKE SNEAKER MODELS OFTEN INCORPORATE ADVANCED CUSHIONING TECHNOLOGIES LIKE AIR MAX, REACT, OR ZOOM, WHICH PROVIDE ALL-DAY SUPPORT AND SHOCK ABSORPTION. A NIKE SNEAKER’S INSOLE IS DESIGNED TO MOLD TO YOUR FOOT SHAPE OVER TIME, MAKING IT IDEAL FOR LONG WALKS, SHOPPING SPREES, OR SPENDING HOURS ON YOUR FEET. MANY NIKE SNEAKER STYLES ALSO HAVE ROOMY TOE BOXES THAT ACCOMMODATE DIFFERENT FOOT TYPES, REDUCING PINCHING OR DISCOMFORT. IN CONTRAST, A PRADA SNEAKER PRIORITIZES STYLE OVER ALL-DAY COMFORT, THOUGH IT DOES FEATURE LUXURY TOUCHES LIKE SOFT LEATHER LININGS. A PRADA SNEAKER’S CUSHIONING IS OFTEN MINIMAL, FOCUSED ON MAINTAINING A SLIM PROFILE RATHER THAN PROVIDING ROBUST SHOCK ABSORPTION. A PRADA SNEAKER MIGHT FEEL STIFF INITIALLY, AND ITS STRUCTURED FIT MAY NOT BE AS FORGIVING FOR PEOPLE WITH WIDE FEET OR THOSE WHO NEED EXTRA SUPPORT.

OVERALL, A NIKE SNEAKER IS BUILT TO DELIVER LONG-LASTING DURABILITY AND ALL-DAY COMFORT FOR CASUAL, FREQUENT USE, WHILE A PRADA SNEAKER OFFERS LUXURY STYLE BUT REQUIRES MORE CAUTION TO PRESERVE ITS DURABILITY AND MAY NOT BE AS COMFORTABLE FOR EXTENDED PERIODS ON YOUR FEET.

P.S. IF YOU’RE LOOKING FOR A SNEAKER THAT CAN KEEP UP WITH YOUR BUSY DAILY ROUTINE, A NIKE SNEAKER IS THE MORE PRACTICAL CHOICE, BUT IF YOU WANT A SNEAKER THAT BLENDS LUXURY FASHION WITH CASUAL WEAR, A PRADA SNEAKER MIGHT FIT YOUR STYLE, PROVIDED YOU TAKE EXTRA CARE TO MAINTAIN ITS CONDITION.

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

* Bullet point two.
...
* Bullet point six.

What is the difference between the 13 colonies and the other British colonies in North America?

Your answer must contain exactly 7 bullet points in a different format, such as:
1. Point one.
2. Point two.
...
7. Point seven.

The difference between the 13 colonies and the other British colonies in North America can be summarized as follows:

① The 13 colonies were situated along the Atlantic coast, while the other colonies were located further inland or in the Caribbean.

② The 13 colonies had a larger population and were more densely populated compared to the other colonies.

③ The 13 colonies had a stronger economic and political influence, as they were established earlier and had more developed institutions.

④ The 13 colonies were more diverse in terms of religious and cultural backgrounds, with a mix of Puritans, Quakers, and other Protestant groups.

⑤ The 13 colonies had a more developed system of self-governance, with elected assemblies and a tradition of resistance against British rule.

⑥ The 13 colonies played a pivotal role in the American Revolution, which led to their independence from Britain.

⑦ The other British colonies remained loyal to the British Crown during the Revolutionary War and did not join the 13 colonies in their quest for independence.
Summarize the historical expansion process of U.S. territory.

output:
* Following the American Revolution and the 1783 Treaty of Paris, the U.S. secured its initial territory: the original 13 colonies plus the Northwest Territory (modern-day Midwest states east of the Mississippi River), laying the continental core of the nation.
* In 1803, the Louisiana Purchase from France for $15 million doubled the country’s size, adding a vast expanse from the Mississippi River to the Rocky Mountains and opening critical space for westward migration and economic growth.
* The 1819 Adams-Onís Treaty with Spain transferred Florida to the U.S. and resolved long-standing border disputes in the Southeast, while also formalizing U.S. claims to parts of the Southwest region.
* The 1845 annexation of the independent Republic of Texas sparked the Mexican-American War; the 1848 Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo ended the conflict, ceding California, New Mexico, and other Southwest territories to the U.S. for $15 million, extending the nation to the Pacific Coast.
* In 1846, a diplomatic compromise with Britain set the U.S.-Canada border at the 49th parallel, securing the Oregon Territory (encompassing modern Oregon, Washington, Idaho, and parts of Montana and Wyoming) for the U.S.
* Later 19th and early 20th-century expansions included Alaska (purchased from Russia in 1867 for $7.2 million), Hawaii (annexed in 1898 after a U.S.-backed coup), and overseas territories like Puerto Rico, Guam, and the Philippines gained from the 1898 Spanish-American War, expanding U.S. global influence beyond the continental mainland.

JOHN OF BRIENNE WORE THE CROWN WITH GRACE AND FORCE.
Provide a detailed biography of John of Brienne, highlighting his journey to becoming the King of Jerusalem, but do not mention any specific dates or years.

output:
* born into a minor noble family in france’s brienne region, john started life with few inherited privileges, forcing him to carve his own path through martial skill and shrewd diplomacy. he gained a reputation as a fierce and reliable knight, serving various european lords and distinguishing himself in skirmishes and larger campaigns, where he proved his ability to lead men and navigate complex political alliances. his humble origins made him an appealing candidate for a desperate throne, as he lacked the powerful backing of major european dynasties that might seek to dominate the fragile realm.
* when the kingdom of jerusalem faced existential threats from surrounding powers and its only heir was a young, unmarried girl, its leaders sent envoys across europe to find a capable warrior-king to protect their lands. john was selected for his proven battlefield prowess and his willingness to commit fully to the kingdom’s defense. he traveled to the holy land, married the young heir, and was crowned king of jerusalem—initially as a consort, but he quickly took full control of governance, rallying local lords, fortifying border strongholds, and leading military campaigns to repel incursions and reclaim lost territories. he worked tirelessly to rebuild the kingdom’s economy and alliances, forging ties with other crusader states and european powers to secure support.
* beyond his rule in jerusalem, john’s career took him across europe and the mediterranean, where he continued to act as a defender of christian interests. he led forces in other conflicts, advised powerful monarchs, and even took on roles in distant realms, leveraging his reputation as a seasoned leader. though he faced constant challenges—from internal court intrigues to overwhelming external enemies—he remained a steadfast advocate for the kingdom of jerusalem throughout his life, leaving a legacy as a pragmatic, resilient ruler who turned his modest beginnings into a reign that sustained a beleaguered crusader state through its darkest hours.

Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response must be enclosed in double quotation marks. Your response must include exactly 8 bullet points in the form of:

* This is bullet 2
...

Write a funny article about why the dinosaurs went extinct.

Your response must be enclosed in single quotation marks. Your response must include exactly 5 bullet points in the form of:
- Point 1
- Point 2
...

'Here's a funny article about why the dinosaurs went extinct:

Dinosaur Extinction: The Untold Truth

We all know the dinosaurs went extinct millions of years ago, but do we really know why? Conventional theories claim a massive asteroid strike or climate change did them in, but recent groundbreaking research has uncovered the true, hilarious reason behind their demise.

- Point 1: Dinosaurs were notoriously bad dancers, and all that stomping around caused catastrophic earthquakes that destabilized the planet.
- Point 2: T-Rex was a notorious prankster, and one of his pranks involving a rubber meteor went terribly wrong.
- Point 3: Triceratops were obsessed with headbutting contests, and they knocked each other out of existence.
- Point 4: Raptors were too busy choreographing elaborate song-and-dance numbers to focus on survival.
- Point 5: Brontosaurus was the ultimate party animal, and the constant raving just couldn't be sustained.'
Describe how dinosaurs could have survived their extinction event.

output:
"* Small, feathered theropods (like Velociraptor relatives) dug deep, insulated burrows lined with their own downy feathers, surviving the impact winter by foraging on insect larvae and decaying plant matter that thrived in warm, protected underground spaces.
* Giant sauropods migrated en masse to geothermally active valleys and volcanic hotspots, where constant volcanic heat kept vegetation (like ferns and mosses) green year-round, providing a steady food source even when sunlight was blocked by impact dust.
* Triceratops and other horned herbivores formed tight, nomadic herds that roamed the post-impact landscape, using their strong beaks to break through tough, fire-resistant plant shoots and bark, and their horns to defend scarce resources from smaller competitors.
* Intelligent theropods such as Troodon created communal food caches in cave systems, storing seeds, small prey, and preserved plant matter to sustain their groups through the darkest months of the impact winter.
* Aquatic dinosaurs like plesiosaurs and mosasaurs retreated to the deepest ocean trenches, where the impact’s surface effects were negligible; they fed on deep-sea organisms like squid and chemosynthetic bacteria that were unaffected by the global dust cloud.
* Armored dinosaurs like Ankylosaurus used their thick, bony plates to shield themselves from post-impact wildfires and falling debris, while their club tails helped them break through fallen tree canopies to access buried roots and tubers for food.
* Pterosaurs evolved longer, more efficient wings to migrate thousands of miles to the southern hemisphere, where the impact winter was less severe, and used their keen eyesight to spot isolated patches of surviving vegetation and small prey.
* Medium-sized herbivores like Iguanodon developed a hibernation-like state, slowing their metabolism to a fraction of its normal rate and surviving for months without food; they woke periodically to feed on the first new growth of ferns and flowering plants that sprouted as the dust cloud cleared."

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response should contain exactly 9 very short bullet points. An example:
* A nucleus is a cluster of protons and neutrons
* A proton is ....
Limit the number of words you use (less than 100 words).

A nucleus is a cluster of protons and neutrons. Elaborate on this.

Your response should contain 5 bullet points. The total number of words used in your response should be at least 200 words.

A nucleus is indeed a cluster of protons and neutrons, and here are five bullet points elaborating on this statement:

• The nucleus is the dense, positively charged core at the center of an atom, composed of protons and neutrons, collectively known as nucleons. It is surrounded by a cloud of negatively charged electrons.

• Protons are positively charged particles, while neutrons have no electrical charge. The number of protons in the nucleus determines the element's atomic number and its chemical properties.

• Neutrons act as a stabilizing force within the nucleus, helping to bind the protons together through the strong nuclear force. The number of neutrons in the nucleus can vary, resulting in different isotopes of the same element.

• The nuclear force, one of the four fundamental forces in nature, is an incredibly strong attractive force that holds the protons and neutrons together within the nucleus. This force overcomes the electrostatic repulsion between the positively charged protons.

• The mass of the nucleus accounts for nearly all the mass of an atom. The nucleons (protons and neutrons) contribute the vast majority of the atom's mass, while the orbiting electrons contribute negligible mass due to their extremely small size.

In total, this response contains 200 words, providing an elaboration on the statement that a nucleus is a cluster of protons and neutrons by highlighting key points such as the composition, charges, forces involved, and the contribution to the atom's mass.
Describe the structure and components of the atomic nucleus in detail.

output:
* Core of atom, holds ~99.9% of its mass
* Made of positively charged protons and neutral neutrons
* Protons define an element’s atomic number
* Neutrons vary per isotope, stabilize the nucleus
* Nucleons (protons/neutrons) are tightly packed
* Bound by strong nuclear force (overcomes proton repulsion)
* Has a tiny radius (~10⁻¹⁵ meters)
* Nucleons contain quarks: protons (2 up,1 down), neutrons (1 up,2 down)
* Features shell structure for nucleons, similar to electron orbitals
